metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: CSS Attribute Selectors
Style HTML Elements With Specific Attributes
It is possible to style HTML elements that have specific attributes or attribute values.
content.html: It is possible to style HTML elements that have specific attributes or attribute values.

content.text: CSS [attribute] Selector
The [attribute] selector is used to select elements with a specified attribute.
content.html: The [attribute] selector is used to select elements with a specified attribute.

content.text: The following example selects all <a> elements with a target attribute:
content.html: The following example selects all <a> elements with a target attribute:

content.code_html:
a[target] {
  background-color: yellow;
}

content.text: CSS [attribute="value"] Selector
The [attribute="value"] selector is used to select elements with a specified attribute and value.
content.html: The [attribute="value"] selector is used to select elements with a specified attribute and value.

content.text: The following example selects all <a> elements with a target="_blank" attribute:
content.html: The following example selects all <a> elements with a target="_blank" attribute:

content.code_html:
a[target="_blank"] {
  background-color: yellow;
}

content.text: CSS [attribute~="value"] Selector
The [attribute~="value"] selector is used to select elements with an attribute value containing a specified word.
content.html: The [attribute~="value"] selector is used to select elements with an attribute value containing a specified word.

content.text: The following example selects all elements with a title attribute that contains a space-separated list of words, one of which is "flower":
content.html: The following example selects all elements with a title attribute that contains a space-separated list of words, one of which is "flower":

content.code_html:
[title~="flower"] {
  border: 5px solid yellow;
}

content.text: The example above will match elements with title="flower", title="summer flower", and title="flower new", but not title="my-flower" or title="flowers".
content.html: The example above will match elements with title="flower", title="summer flower", and title="flower new", but not title="my-flower" or title="flowers".

content.text: CSS [attribute|="value"] Selector
The [attribute|="value"] selector is used to select elements with the specified attribute, whose value can be exactly the specified value, or the specified value followed by a hyphen (-).
content.html: The [attribute|="value"] selector is used to select elements with the specified attribute, whose value can be exactly the specified value, or the specified value followed by a hyphen (-).

content.text: Note: The value has to be a whole word, either alone, like class="top", or followed by a hyphen( - ), like class="top-text".
content.html: Note: The value has to be a whole word, either alone, like class="top", or followed by a hyphen( - ), like class="top-text".

content.code_html:
[class|="top"] {
  background: yellow;
}

content.text: CSS [attribute^="value"] Selector
The [attribute^="value"] selector is used to select elements with the specified attribute, whose value starts with the specified value.
content.html: The [attribute^="value"] selector is used to select elements with the specified attribute, whose value starts with the specified value.

content.text: The following example selects all elements with a class attribute value that starts with "top":
content.html: The following example selects all elements with a class attribute value that starts with "top":

content.text: Note: The value does not have to be a whole word!
content.html: Note: The value does not have to be a whole word!

content.code_html:
[class^="top"] {
  background: yellow;
}

content.text: CSS [attribute$="value"] Selector
The [attribute$="value"] selector is used to select elements whose attribute value ends with a specified value.
content.html: The [attribute$="value"] selector is used to select elements whose attribute value ends with a specified value.

content.text: The following example selects all elements with a class attribute value that ends with "test":
content.html: The following example selects all elements with a class attribute value that ends with "test":

content.text: Note: The value does not have to be a whole word!
content.html: Note: The value does not have to be a whole word!

content.code_html:
[class$="test"] {
  background: yellow;
}

content.text: CSS [attribute*="value"] Selector
The [attribute*="value"] selector is used to select elements whose attribute value contains a specified value.
content.html: The [attribute*="value"] selector is used to select elements whose attribute value contains a specified value.

content.text: The following example selects all elements with a class attribute value that contains "te":
content.html: The following example selects all elements with a class attribute value that contains "te":

content.text: Note: The value does not have to be a whole word!
content.html: Note: The value does not have to be a whole word!

content.code_html:
[class*="te"] {
  background: yellow;
}

content.text: Styling Forms
The attribute selectors can be useful for styling forms without class or ID:
content.html: The attribute selectors can be useful for styling forms without class or ID:

content.code_html:
input[type="text"] {
  width: 150px;
  display: block;
  margin-bottom: 10px;
  background-color: yellow;
}

input[type="button"] {
  width: 120px;
  margin-left: 35px;
  display: block;
}

content.text: Tip: Visit our CSS Forms Tutorial for more examples on how to style forms with CSS.
content.html: Tip: Visit our CSS Forms Tutorial for more examples on how to style forms with CSS.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
Which selector matches elements with a class attribute value that starts with "top" ?
content.html: Which selector matches elements with a class attribute value that starts with "top"?

metadata.question: Which selector matches elements with a class attribute value that starts with "top"?

content.question: Which selector matches elements with a class attribute value that starts with "top"?

content.text: All CSS Attribute Selectors

content.code_html:
Selector Example Example description
[attribute] [target] Selects all elements with a target attribute
[attribute=value] [target="_blank"] Selects all elements with target="_blank"
[attribute~=value] [title~="flower"] Selects all elements with a title attribute that contains a space-separated list of words, one of which is "flower"
[attribute|=value] [lang|="en"] Selects all elements with a lang attribute value starting with "en"
[attribute^=value] a[href^="https"] Selects all <a> elements with a href attribute value starting with "https"
[attribute$=value] a[href$=".pdf"] Selects all <a> elements with a href attribute value ending with ".pdf"
[attribute*=value] a[href*="w3schools"] Selects all <a> elements with a href attribute value containing the substring "w3schools"
